definitions.definition: not needed; more than is needed
definitions.sensetop: it is unnecessary to do somethingit is unnecessary for somebody/something to do something

examples.text: They were found guilty of causing unnecessary suffering to animals.
All this fuss is totally unnecessary.
It was unnecessary to carry out more stringent safety testing.
examples.contextForm: it is unnecessary to do something

examples.text: They argued that it was unnecessary for government to regulate the industry.
examples.contextForm: it is unnecessary for somebody/something to do something

examples.text: Cigarette smoking causes 450,000 unnecessary deaths every year.
Antibiotics should be unnecessary for most patients with a sore throat.
She gave her parents unnecessary worry when she forgot to call them.
The police stand accused of the use of wholly unnecessary violence during the arrest.
the possession of items strictly unnecessary to survival
Critics of the mayor denounced the idea as unnecessary for the city

definitions.definition: not needed in the situation and likely to be offensive

examples.text: That last comment was a little unnecessary, wasn't it?
That was quite unnecessary and I want you to apologize.
